pr_title: Fix LoggingOutputStream to work on windows

timeline.message:
Fix LoggingOutputStream to work on windows

LoggingOutputStream reads a stream and breaks on newlines. This commit
fixes the behavior to account for windows newlines also containing `\r`.

closes #51532

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't this throw a ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception for instances where we attempt to write a line which is simply a single \n character? I think we need to add a bounds check here.
timeline.author: mark-vieira

replies.bodyText: used - 1 is the last character of the buffer, and we know the buffer size is at least 1 because of the check on line 93.
replies.author: rjernst

replies.bodyText: I see what's happening now. I misunderstood the \n character itself to be part of this buffer but it's not. Nevermind.
replies.author: mark-vieira
